docs.lead_paragraph: Some fear that while healthy employees might reap health insurance discounts, workplace programs could end up raising costs for the chronically ill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Doctor and Patient Dr. Pauline W. Chen posted at nytimes.com/health.

headline.main: POSTINGS  |  RECENT ENTRIES FROM OUR BLOGS

docs.abstract: Dr Pauline W Chen blog entry laments amount of time that hospital personnel need to fill out necessary paperwork and record-keeping; says that medical staff needs more time face to face with patients; Paula Span blog entry suggests that health care professionals do more thorough job of screening for alcohol and drug problems; says even moderate drinking can cause medical problems later in life (M)
docs.snippet: Doctor and Patient     Dr. Pauline W. Chen posted at nytimes.com/health.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal judge who rejected a settlement last month of lawsuits filed by rescue and cleanup workers at ground zero said on Monday at a hearing that no progress appeared to have been made in renegotiating the accord.

headline.main: Judge Sees No Progress on Ground Zero Settlement

docs.abstract: A judge sees no progress toward renegotiating a settlement of lawsuits filed over health damages at ground zero.
docs.snippet: A judge sees no progress toward renegotiating a settlement of lawsuits filed over health damages at ground zero.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Will These Changes Increase My Health Care Premiums?

docs.abstract: How the changes will affect existing insurance costs is a source of debate.
docs.snippet: How the changes will affect existing insurance costs is a source of debate.

headline.main: Will Reforms Help Young, Healthy Adults Without Insurance?

docs.abstract: Starting in September, the new law will allow adult children younger than 26 to be added to their parent's health policy.
docs.snippet: Starting in September, the new law will allow adult children younger than 26 to be added to their parent's health policy.

headline.main: How Will the Law Affect Children With Pre-Existing Conditions?

docs.abstract: The new law is expected to stop insurance companies from rejecting children or excluding coverage because of pre-existing medical problems.
docs.snippet: The new law is expected to stop insurance companies from rejecting children or excluding coverage because of pre-existing medical problems.

headline.main: How Will the Law Affect Medicare Advantage?

docs.abstract: Medicare Advantage plans will be cut beginning in 2012 as the federal reimbursement formula is brought in line with traditional Medicare.
docs.snippet: Medicare Advantage plans will be cut beginning in 2012 as the federal reimbursement formula is brought in line with traditional Medicare.
